alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 3:43AM CST until February 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A mixture of freezing rain, sleet and snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches with local amounts up to 8 inches with heaviest snow totals along and north of Interstate 44. Snow and sleet accumulation of 2 to 5 inches south of Interstate 44 through far northwest Arkansas. Ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch with locally higher amounts up to two tenths of an inch possible across far northwest Arkansas. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Oklahoma and far northwest Arkansas. * WHEN...Through midnight CST Thursday night. Initial winter weather this morning will focus along and north of a line from about Tulsa Oklahoma to Bentonville Arkansas the early morning hours. Temperatures will fall below freezing through the day and winter weather will spread southward. * IMPACTS...Travel could be impacted during the morning commute this morning. More widespread wintry precipitation will expand across the region beginning mid afternoon Wednesday and become heavy Wednesday evening through the early morning hours Thursday. Expect travel conditions to become hazardous. Localized power outages should also be anticipated as winds increase and interact with any ice coated power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous wind chill values will also develop Wednesday night with values of zero to minus 10 degrees likely. Dangerous wind chills will persist into Friday morning with wind chills largely between 0 and minus 5 degrees within the warned area.
info.instruction: Roads, bridges, and overpasses in the warning area are expected to become slick and hazardous. If travel is absolutely necessary, take a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as a first aid kit, water, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
